description: From Middle English tiȝing, teing, from Old English *tīgung, tīging (“connection”), from Proto-Germanic *taugungō, from *taugijaną from Proto-Indo-European *dewk- (“to tug, draw”). Equivalent to tie +‎ -ing. Present participle from Old English tīgende, from tīgan, tīegan.

entries.meaning: Action of the verb to tie; ligature.
examples: It cost us several tyings and untyings before her ladyship was pleased with her own foot.

entries.meaning: (mining) The act or process of washing ores in a buddle.
